txt: Prayer for rain (salat al-’istisqa’) has been expressly mentioned in the Qur’an and the Sunnah, and there is consensus concerning it. Allah(SWT) says:
'فَقُلْتُ اسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفَّارًا (10) يُرْسِلِ السَّمَاءَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِدْرَارًا'(71:10)
And I said: 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord; surely He is ever All forgiving, and He will loose heaven upon you in torrents. (Qur’an 71:10-11)

A tradition reports that once when the people of Madinah were facing drought and the Prophet (PBUH) was delivering a sermon, a man stood up and said: 'Horses and women have perished. Pray to God to give us rain.' The Prophet (PBUH) extended his hands and prayed.
